meanings.definition: To make someone or something late or slow
meanings.sent1: The traffic jam will delay our arrival at the party.
meanings.sent2: Please don't delay the train departure any further.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to delay the turtle's progress in the race.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain delayed the progress of the construction workers.
meanings.sent5: The slow internet connection can often delay video streaming.

meanings.definition: A period of time when someone or something is late or slow
meanings.sent1: The flight experienced a two-hour delay due to bad weather.
meanings.sent2: She experienced a delay in receiving her online order.
meanings.sent3: The delay in the bus schedule caused some passengers to miss their appointments.
meanings.sent4: The delay in the project completion was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The delay in the mail delivery caused inconvenience to many customers.

meanings.definition: To postpone or put off something to a later time
meanings.sent1: We had to delay the meeting until next week due to scheduling conflicts.
meanings.sent2: The decision to delay the event was made to ensure better preparation.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to delay studying for the exam by watching TV.
meanings.sent4: She decided to delay her vacation to save more money.
meanings.sent5: The company had to delay the product launch to fix a technical issue.
